author: {'steamid': '76561198132995625', 'num_games_owned': 1414, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 915, 'last_played': 1691194373}
review:
[h1] Viking Saga: New World [/h1]
Collection game from 2015.
5,600th review in my archive.

Help the Viking king find a cure!
Several years have passed since Ingolf became King of Iceland. He married his beloved Dalla and they had two wonderful children. Ingolf's lands prospered and grew. But one day a terrible danger reached the lands of the brave king. An unknown disease began to spread throughout the kingdom. To save his family and people, Ingolf must travel to the far west and find a cure!
Travel to the Far West! Visit wondrous places of the ancient world! Meet new interesting characters and discover their fascinating stories! Find a cure and save your kingdom! (Developer)

So much for the story, which is actually quite good. BUT; since when is the old world west of Iceland? But that would be really far west, around one time around the planet, for example. And anyway, since when is the continent of America the old world?
The story is complete nonsense and also both historically and historically a total distortion of all facts. On top of that, Vikings means something like summertime pirates and plunderers. Kind of a hobby, young Norsemen who plundered coasts for about 300 years.

Collect, build and remove blockages under time pressure. The time pressure can be switched off, but does not stop completely. The maps are very well made and fun for half the game. Then it just gets annoying because of the gameplay. Technically speaking, however, this game is well made, there's no doubt about that.
The distribution of resources is also very successful, which has to be acknowledged. For my part, I still don't recommend it. However, if you feel like constantly lighting campfires, draining puddles, clearing falls and getting rid of spiders, then you've found the game of your dreams.
Not recommended.

My group and my archive with over 5,600 reviews here: https://steamcommunity.com/groups/hoi4deu

author: {'steamid': '76561198178804729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1584872548}
review:
Eigentlich mag ich Time Management Spiele sehr gerne und hab auch den ersten Teil durchgespielt. "New World" hat mir aber leider gar nicht gefallen. Das Gameplay konzentriert sich diesmal viel zu stark auf "Upkeep" d.h. man muss st√§ndig Lagerfeuer am Brennen halten, wiederkehrendes Ger√∂ll aus dem Weg schaffen oder wiederkehrende Pf√ºtzen trockenlegen. Das nervt, weil man sich dauernd auf solche Kinkerlitzchen konzentrieren muss, statt sich auf das Ziel des Levels fokussieren zu k√∂nnen.

Abgebrochen hab ich dann bei den Waldbrand-Levels, in denen man jedes Objekt im Level l√∂schen muss. W√§hrend dessen soll man trotzdem Lagerfeuer am Brennen halten. Zu allem √úberfluss beginnen auch noch die eigenen errichteten Geb√§ude zu brennen. L√∂scht man diese, werden sie zu Ruinen, die erst mal abgerissen werden m√ºssen bevor man sie neu bauen muss. Das macht mir schlicht und einfach keinen Spa√ü.

Ach ja: Wie schon Teil 1 gibt es Probleme mit der Anzeige, wenn als Textgr√∂√üe 125% eingestellt ist. Das hat aber keinen Einfluss auf meine Wertung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1524162112}
review:
[h1]Short version: 70%[/h1]
The second entry of the Viking Saga series spices up the scenery by putting us on a long journey from Iceland to Peru. Its time management mechanics and the difficulty curve ensure that most players can enjoy it, albeit to a limited degree.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Ingolf is back in the second episode of Viking Saga, but he will not enjoy his peace for long, because he has to travel to the New World to find a legendary medicine for his people. 
As usual for a time manager, do not expect too much from this plot other than an excuse to change the scenery occasionally. However, the pacing and story is entertaining enough to act as a secondary incentive to pass each stage, beyond seeing what the next level will offer in terms of challenges.

And challenges ye shall have, since Viking Saga 2 is enthusiastic about using stage hazards on most levels, ranging from downpour to forest fires, pitch-black nights, or pressure plate door switches. These require a constant influx of raw materials, which we acquire by building lodgings, collecting rent from them, and then sending our workers to the production buildings‚Äîso, in essence, the same way we did in the first game.
These hazards are a great way to add intensity; however, they can also wear the player out eventually, so I suggest playing this game only in bite-sized chunks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031643168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1685349071}
review:
Fun, interesting game with new ideas. Once you learn the start build formula it's much easier, but you'll still be challenged accomplishing goals. Each new land/map adds elements so it stays fresh enough throughout the game. 
The hardest part for me was dealing with the fires. Wow, thought there was no way until I tried putting out 1-2 fires on nearby islands before building anything. That was the secret for 3 stars!! Had to play plenty of levels over for 3 stars so I appreciated the challenge.

The story is good enough. Graphics and animations were cool. Overall it's worth it. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198195912827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 9, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1712055895}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054157182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1476972763}
review:
It's a good game in the series. 40 levels + 4 bonus levels, with a lot of gameplay variations: light fires to repel fogs, drain the rain, fight the spider nests, etc. 

I got 3 stars on all levels after 1 to 3 tries on each level. The time limits are well chosen.
If you like time management games, I recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989054357', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1520889246}
review:
I've been playing several of these games over the past week, and while as a genre they're cute, relaxing, and provide a minor challenge, this one falls short of Roads of Roam 2 for example in a few ways.

The writing is fairly poor; it seems badly translated and includes mistakes. Frankly the story isn't at all interesting, but that's not why you'd buy this anyway. 

Your workers don't work quite fast enough, and this gets tedious fairly quickly. Even with six running around, because of the various obstacles a lot of actions queue up.

The voices are really annoying and there's a bug with the option to disable them; it doesn't always work, either at all or from one mission to the next.

These are minor complaints really, and for the price and the apparent length of the game, I'd still recommend it. 3/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198047274172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1563003329}
review:
When I purchased this game, I had no idea what I was in for considering that the trailer, screenshots and blurb gave absolutely no useful information about the gameplay mechanics, genre or overall target audience.

However... I'm happy with my purchase. It's not a smash hit, but I think it's very well done.

The best way I can describe this game would be as a Settlers clone. For anyone who is a fan of Time-Management and/or Strategy Games, Viking Saga: New World will be an instant classic for you.

I found the artwork simple, but defined. The cut scene animations blended perfectly with the artwork and the voice narration gives you the chance to admire this instead of making you read subtitles. The soundtrack was relaxing and didn't get in the way of the voice and sound effects during gameplay.

Despite sometimes miss-clicking structures or gatherables while aiming for something else, the gameplay was satisfying. At times I would get frustrated and deside the fog-of-war overlay was crap because I couldn't see through it or the cost to clear rubble or repair a bridge was too high and life for these vikings was just unfair!... But truth is, I like the challenge!

I found the goals for the levels were extremely well balanced (at least so far) and it would appear alot of effort has gone into ensuring that this game isn't just a push over. If you're after that perfect 3-star score every time, keep your eyes pealed. I found some new ideas thrown into the mix that I haven't found in other games of the genre. I won't give any spoilers as to what those are though. I think if you're into stuff like Build-A-Lot or Cake Mania, ditch Big Fish Games and get this instead!

At the end of the day, I think the price was well earned and worth it. Good job.
